Proverb_Text: A bird in the hand is worth two in the bush
Meaning: It's better to have a sure thing than to risk it for something uncertain

Proverb_Text: Actions speak louder than words
Meaning: What people do is more important than what they say

Proverb_Text: The early bird catches the worm
Meaning: Those who start early or act promptly have the best chance of success

Proverb_Text: Don't count your chickens before they hatch
Meaning: Don't make plans based on events that haven't happened yet

Proverb_Text: When in Rome do as the Romans do
Meaning: Adapt to the customs of the places you visit

Proverb_Text: All that glitters is not gold
Meaning: Appearances can be deceiving; not everything that looks valuable is valuable

Proverb_Text: Better late than never
Meaning: It's better to do something late than not do it at all

Proverb_Text: Don't put all your eggs in one basket
Meaning: Don't risk everything on a single venture; spread your risks

Proverb_Text: Every cloud has a silver lining
Meaning: There is something good in every bad situation

Proverb_Text: Fortune favors the bold
Meaning: Those who are brave and take risks are more likely to be successful

Proverb_Text: Honesty is the best policy
Meaning: Being truthful is always the best approach in the long run

Proverb_Text: If you can't beat them join them
Meaning: If you cannot defeat your opponents it's sometimes better to ally with them

Proverb_Text: It takes two to tango
Meaning: Both parties in a situation are responsible for what happens

Proverb_Text: Knowledge is power
Meaning: Having knowledge gives you influence and control

Proverb_Text: Look before you leap
Meaning: Think carefully before taking action

Proverb_Text: Money doesn't grow on trees
Meaning: Money is limited and must be earned through work

Proverb_Text: No pain no gain
Meaning: You must work hard and make sacrifices to achieve your goals

Proverb_Text: Practice makes perfect
Meaning: Repeated practice leads to mastery

Proverb_Text: Rome wasn't built in a day
Meaning: Important work takes time and cannot be rushed

Proverb_Text: The pen is mightier than the sword
Meaning: Ideas and communication are more powerful than violence

Proverb_Text: There's no place like home
Meaning: Home is the most comfortable and welcoming place

Proverb_Text: Time is money
Meaning: Time is a valuable resource and should not be wasted

Proverb_Text: Two heads are better than one
Meaning: Working together produces better results than working alone

Proverb_Text: You can't judge a book by its cover
Meaning: You shouldn't form opinions based on outward appearance alone

Proverb_Text: You reap what you sow
Meaning: Your actions determine the results you get

Proverb_Text: A stitch in time saves nine
Meaning: Dealing with problems early prevents them from becoming bigger

Proverb_Text: Absence makes the heart grow fonder
Meaning: Being apart from someone increases your affection for them

Proverb_Text: Beggars can't be choosers
Meaning: Those in need should be grateful for what they receive

Proverb_Text: Blood is thicker than water
Meaning: Family relationships are stronger than other relationships

Proverb_Text: Curiosity killed the cat
Meaning: Being too inquisitive or nosy can lead to trouble

Proverb_Text: Don't bite the hand that feeds you
Meaning: Don't harm those who help or support you

Proverb_Text: Easy come easy go
Meaning: Things acquired without effort are lost just as easily

Proverb_Text: God helps those who help themselves
Meaning: You must take action yourself not just wait for divine help

Proverb_Text: Haste makes waste
Meaning: Doing things too quickly leads to mistakes and waste

Proverb_Text: Laughter is the best medicine
Meaning: Humor and joy promote healing and wellbeing

Proverb_Text: Let sleeping dogs lie
Meaning: Don't interfere with a situation that could cause trouble

Proverb_Text: Necessity is the mother of invention
Meaning: Need and difficulty inspire creative solutions

Proverb_Text: Out of sight out of mind
Meaning: What you don't see regularly is easily forgotten

Proverb_Text: The grass is always greener on the other side
Meaning: Other people's situations always seem better than your own

Proverb_Text: Where there's smoke there's fire
Meaning: Rumors or signs usually indicate some underlying truth

Proverb_Text: You can lead a horse to water but you can't make it drink
Meaning: You can provide opportunities but cannot force people to take them

Proverb_Text: A penny saved is a penny earned
Meaning: Saving money is as valuable as earning it

Proverb_Text: Don't cry over spilled milk
Meaning: Don't waste time lamenting past mistakes that cannot be changed

Proverb_Text: Strike while the iron is hot
Meaning: Take advantage of favorable circumstances immediately

Proverb_Text: The apple doesn't fall far from the tree
Meaning: Children often resemble their parents in character or behavior

Proverb_Text: Too many cooks spoil the broth
Meaning: Too many people involved in a task can ruin it

Proverb_Text: What goes around comes around
Meaning: Your actions good or bad will eventually return to you

Proverb_Text: A friend in need is a friend indeed
Meaning: True friends are those who help in difficult times

Proverb_Text: He who laughs last laughs best
Meaning: The person who ultimately succeeds has the last and best laugh

Proverb_Text: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step
Meaning: Great achievements start with small initial actions

Proverb_Text: When the winds of change blow some build walls others build windmills
Meaning: People respond to change differently; some resist while others embrace it

Proverb_Text: Give a man a fish and you feed him for a day; teach a man to fish and you feed him for a lifetime
Meaning: Teaching skills is better than providing temporary help

Proverb_Text: The best time to plant a tree was twenty years ago; the second best time is now
Meaning: It's never too late to start something beneficial

Proverb_Text: A diamond with a flaw is worth more than a pebble without imperfections
Meaning: Something valuable with minor flaws exceeds something worthless that's perfect

Proverb_Text: Fall seven times stand up eight
Meaning: Always get back up after failure no matter how many times you fall

Proverb_Text: The nail that sticks out gets hammered down
Meaning: Those who are different or stand out attract criticism or punishment

Proverb_Text: Even monkeys fall from trees
Meaning: Even experts and skilled people make mistakes

Proverb_Text: Vision without action is a daydream; action without vision is a nightmare
Meaning: Both vision and action are necessary for success

Proverb_Text: One kind word can warm three winter months
Meaning: Small acts of kindness have lasting positive effects

Proverb_Text: Patience is bitter but its fruit is sweet
Meaning: Practicing patience is difficult but leads to rewarding outcomes

Proverb_Text: A book is like a garden carried in the pocket
Meaning: Books contain worlds of knowledge accessible anywhere

Proverb_Text: The dogs bark but the caravan moves on
Meaning: Don't let critics stop your progress

Proverb_Text: He who has health has hope and he who has hope has everything
Meaning: Health enables all life's possibilities

Proverb_Text: Write the bad things done to you in sand but write the good things in stone
Meaning: Remember kindnesses forget wrongs

Proverb_Text: The fruit of silence is tranquility
Meaning: Keeping silent brings inner peace

Proverb_Text: A thousand friends are too few one enemy is too many
Meaning: You can never have too many friends but even one enemy is problematic

Proverb_Text: He who digs a pit for others will fall into it himself
Meaning: Harm intended for others will backfire on you

Proverb_Text: Coffee should be black as hell strong as death and sweet as love
Meaning: Description of the ideal Turkish coffee

Proverb_Text: Not every sweet root gives birth to sweet grass
Meaning: Good parents may have difficult children

Proverb_Text: A narrow space looks wide to the narrow-minded
Meaning: Limited thinking sees everything as limited

Proverb_Text: Until lions have their historians tales of the hunt shall always glorify the hunter
Meaning: History is written by those in power

Proverb_Text: If you want to go fast go alone; if you want to go far go together
Meaning: Individual effort brings quick results but teamwork achieves lasting success

Proverb_Text: Smooth seas do not make skillful sailors
Meaning: Difficulties and challenges develop abilities and skills

Proverb_Text: The child who is not embraced by the village will burn it down to feel its warmth
Meaning: Those rejected by their community may become destructive

Proverb_Text: When there is no enemy within the enemies outside cannot hurt you
Meaning: Internal peace protects you from external threats

Proverb_Text: However long the night the dawn will break
Meaning: Difficult times will eventually end

Proverb_Text: A tree is known by its fruit
Meaning: People are judged by their deeds not their words

Proverb_Text: Pride goes before destruction
Meaning: Arrogance and excessive pride lead to downfall

Proverb_Text: The love of money is the root of all evil
Meaning: Excessive desire for wealth causes many problems

Proverb_Text: Do unto others as you would have them do unto you
Meaning: Treat others the way you wish to be treated

Proverb_Text: The truth will set you free
Meaning: Honesty and truth bring liberation

Proverb_Text: He who is without sin cast the first stone
Meaning: Don't judge others when you have faults yourself

Proverb_Text: Who much embraces little squeezes
Meaning: Those who try to do too much accomplish little

Proverb_Text: There is no bad from which good does not come
Meaning: Every negative situation brings some positive outcome

Proverb_Text: If you want to know the road ahead, ask those coming back
Meaning: Seek advice from those who have already experienced what you are facing

Proverb_Text: To a gifted horse don't look at its teeth
Meaning: Don't criticize or scrutinize a gift

Proverb_Text: Tell me with whom you walk and I'll tell you who you are
Meaning: You're known and influenced by the company you keep

Proverb_Text: In closed mouth flies don't enter
Meaning: Keeping quiet prevents trouble

Proverb_Text: The habit doesn't make the monk
Meaning: Clothes and appearance don't define a person's character

Proverb_Text: Who sows winds reaps storms
Meaning: Negative actions lead to worse outcomes

Proverb_Text: He who goes slowly goes safely and goes far
Meaning: Going slowly and carefully leads to long-term success

Proverb_Text: Appetite comes with eating
Meaning: Doing something increases your desire to do more of it

Proverb_Text: Between saying and doing there is a long way
Meaning: There's a big difference between talking and actually doing something

Proverb_Text: Who sleeps doesn't catch fish
Meaning: You must be active and work to achieve results

Proverb_Text: Not to have all cups in the cupboard
Meaning: To be crazy or not thinking clearly

Proverb_Text: Morning hour has gold in its mouth
Meaning: Early morning is the most valuable and productive time

Proverb_Text: Who digs a pit for others falls into it himself
Meaning: Those who try to harm others end up harming themselves

Proverb_Text: All beginning is difficult
Meaning: Starting something new is always the hardest part

Proverb_Text: Where there is a will, there is a way
Meaning: Commitment leads to finding a solution to any problem

Proverb_Text: Little by little the bird builds its nest
Meaning: Small consistent efforts lead to completion

Proverb_Text: Who risks nothing has nothing
Meaning: You must take risks to gain rewards

Proverb_Text: To want is to be able
Meaning: Where there's a will there's a way

Proverb_Text: You can't make an omelet without breaking eggs
Meaning: Achievement requires some destruction or cost

Proverb_Text: The more things change the more they stay the same
Meaning: Despite surface changes fundamental things remain the same

Proverb_Text: Seize the day
Meaning: Make the most of the present moment

Proverb_Text: In wine there is truth
Meaning: People speak more honestly when intoxicated

Proverb_Text: Time flies
Meaning: Time passes quickly

Proverb_Text: I came I saw I conquered
Meaning: Statement of swift and complete victory

Proverb_Text: There is no accounting for taste
Meaning: People's tastes and preferences vary inexplicably

Proverb_Text: To each his own
Meaning: Everyone has different tastes and that's acceptable

Proverb_Text: What doesn't kill you makes you stronger
Meaning: Surviving hardship builds character and strength

Proverb_Text: Still waters run deep
Meaning: Quiet people often have profound thoughts and feelings

Proverb_Text: The devil is in the details
Meaning: Small things can cause significant problems

Proverb_Text: A watched pot never boils
Meaning: Waiting and watching makes time seem to pass more slowly

Proverb_Text: Better the devil you know than the devil you don't
Meaning: Known problems are preferable to unknown ones

Proverb_Text: Fool me once shame on you fool me twice shame on me
Meaning: Being deceived twice is your own fault

Proverb_Text: A leopard can't change its spots
Meaning: People's fundamental nature cannot change

Proverb_Text: Don't throw the baby out with the bathwater
Meaning: Don't discard something valuable while eliminating waste

Proverb_Text: The road to hell is paved with good intentions
Meaning: Good intentions without action are worthless or harmful

Proverb_Text: A chain is only as strong as its weakest link
Meaning: A group's strength depends on its weakest member

Proverb_Text: Birds of a feather flock together
Meaning: Similar people naturally associate with each other

Proverb_Text: Don't put the cart before the horse
Meaning: Do things in the proper sequence

Proverb_Text: Every dog has its day
Meaning: Everyone gets their chance at success eventually

Proverb_Text: Great minds think alike
Meaning: Intelligent people often reach similar conclusions

Proverb_Text: Kill two birds with one stone
Meaning: Accomplish two things with a single action

Proverb_Text: Let bygones be bygones
Meaning: Forget and forgive past conflicts

Proverb_Text: Make hay while the sun shines
Meaning: Take advantage of good conditions while they last

Proverb_Text: Never look a gift horse in the mouth
Meaning: Don't question or criticize the value of a gift

Proverb_Text: Once bitten twice shy
Meaning: Bad experiences make you cautious about similar situations

Proverb_Text: People who live in glass houses shouldn't throw stones
Meaning: Don't criticize others when you have similar faults

Proverb_Text: The squeaky wheel gets the grease
Meaning: Those who complain or speak up get attention and help

Proverb_Text: There's many a slip between cup and lip
Meaning: Things can go wrong at the last moment

Proverb_Text: When the cat's away the mice will play
Meaning: People misbehave when authority figures are absent

Proverb_Text: You can't teach an old dog new tricks
Meaning: Older people or those set in their ways resist learning new things

Proverb_Text: A bad workman blames his tools
Meaning: Incompetent people blame external factors for their failures

Proverb_Text: A fool and his money are soon parted
Meaning: Foolish people waste money quickly

Proverb_Text: A house divided against itself cannot stand
Meaning: Internal conflict will destroy any group or organization

Proverb_Text: A problem shared is a problem halved
Meaning: Discussing problems with others reduces their burden

Proverb_Text: A soft answer turns away wrath
Meaning: Gentle responses defuse anger and conflict

Proverb_Text: Adversity makes strange bedfellows
Meaning: Difficult times create unlikely partnerships

Proverb_Text: All good things come to those who wait
Meaning: Patience brings positive outcomes

Proverb_Text: All roads lead to Rome
Meaning: Many different paths can lead to the same goal

Proverb_Text: All work and no play makes Jack a dull boy
Meaning: Life needs balance between work and leisure

Proverb_Text: An apple a day keeps the doctor away
Meaning: Good daily habits prevent illness

Proverb_Text: An idle mind is the devil's workshop
Meaning: Lack of activity leads to trouble and bad thoughts

Proverb_Text: April showers bring May flowers
Meaning: Difficult or unpleasant times lead to better times

Proverb_Text: As you make your bed so you must lie in it
Meaning: You must accept the results of your own actions

Proverb_Text: Ask no questions and hear no lies
Meaning: Not asking prevents hearing unpleasant or false information

Proverb_Text: Attack is the best form of defense
Meaning: Taking initiative provides strategic advantage

Proverb_Text: Beauty is in the eye of the beholder
Meaning: Beauty is subjective and varies by person

Proverb_Text: Beauty is only skin deep
Meaning: Physical appearance doesn't reflect inner qualities

Proverb_Text: Behind every great man there's a great woman
Meaning: Successful people often have supportive partners

Proverb_Text: Better safe than sorry
Meaning: Taking precautions prevents future regret

Proverb_Text: Better to remain silent and be thought a fool than to speak and remove all doubt
Meaning: Speaking foolishly confirms stupidity while silence maintains doubt

Proverb_Text: Between a rock and a hard place
Meaning: Facing two equally difficult or unpleasant options

Proverb_Text: Big fish eat little fish
Meaning: The powerful dominate and consume the weak

Proverb_Text: Brevity is the soul of wit
Meaning: Being concise and brief shows intelligence and humor

Proverb_Text: Charity begins at home
Meaning: Take care of your own family before helping others

Proverb_Text: Cleanliness is next to godliness
Meaning: Being clean is a virtue close to being holy

Proverb_Text: Clothes make the man
Meaning: How you dress influences how others perceive you

Proverb_Text: Dead men tell no tales
Meaning: The dead cannot reveal secrets

Proverb_Text: Distance makes the heart grow fonder
Meaning: Being apart increases affection and appreciation

Proverb_Text: Don't bite off more than you can chew
Meaning: Don't take on more than you can handle

Proverb_Text: Don't burn your bridges
Meaning: Maintain relationships as you may need them later

Proverb_Text: Don't cast pearls before swine
Meaning: Don't offer valuable things to those who can't appreciate them

Proverb_Text: Don't cross the bridge till you come to it
Meaning: Don't worry about future problems before they occur

Proverb_Text: Don't make a mountain out of a molehill
Meaning: Don't exaggerate the importance of small problems

Proverb_Text: Don't rock the boat
Meaning: Don't disturb a stable situation

Proverb_Text: Don't shut the stable door after the horse has bolted

Proverb_Text: Don't throw good money after bad

Proverb_Text: Don't wash your dirty linen in public
Meaning: Keep private family matters private

Proverb_Text: Empty vessels make the most noise
Meaning: Ignorant or foolish people talk the most

Proverb_Text: Even a broken clock is right twice a day
Meaning: Even consistently wrong sources are occasionally correct by chance

Proverb_Text: Every man for himself
Meaning: In crisis situations people prioritize their own survival

Proverb_Text: Every picture tells a story
Meaning: Visual representations convey meaningful narratives

Proverb_Text: Everything comes to him who waits
Meaning: Patient people eventually receive what they desire

Proverb_Text: Faint heart never won fair lady
Meaning: Timidity and lack of courage don't win affection or success

Proverb_Text: Familiarity breeds contempt
Meaning: Too much closeness or familiarity creates disrespect

Proverb_Text: First come first served
Meaning: Priority and service go to those who arrive first

Proverb_Text: First impressions are the most lasting
Meaning: Initial impressions are difficult to change later

Proverb_Text: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread
Meaning: Foolish people take dangerous risks that wise people avoid

Proverb_Text: Forewarned is forearmed
Meaning: Advance warning enables proper preparation

Proverb_Text: Forgive and forget
Meaning: Let go of past wrongs completely

Proverb_Text: Give credit where credit is due
Meaning: Acknowledge and recognize others' contributions properly

Proverb_Text: Give him an inch and he'll take a mile
Meaning: Small concessions lead to increasingly larger demands

Proverb_Text: Good fences make good neighbors
Meaning: Respecting boundaries maintains harmonious relationships

Proverb_Text: Good things come in small packages
Meaning: Size doesn't determine quality or value

Proverb_Text: Great oaks from little acorns grow
Meaning: Great achievements have small beginnings

Proverb_Text: Half a loaf is better than no bread
Meaning: Having something is better than having nothing

Proverb_Text: Handsome is as handsome does
Meaning: True beauty comes from good deeds not physical appearance

Proverb_Text: He who hesitates is lost
Meaning: Indecision causes missed opportunities

Proverb_Text: He who lives by the sword dies by the sword
Meaning: Those who use violence will face violence themselves

Proverb_Text: He who pays the piper calls the tune
Meaning: Those who provide resources have control over decisions

Proverb_Text: Hell hath no fury like a woman scorned
Meaning: A rejected woman's anger is extremely fierce

Proverb_Text: History repeats itself
Meaning: Past events and patterns tend to recur

Proverb_Text: Home is where the heart is
Meaning: Home is wherever your loved ones are

Proverb_Text: Hope springs eternal
Meaning: Hope never completely dies in human hearts

Proverb_Text: If at first you don't succeed try try again
Meaning: Keep attempting after initial failures

Proverb_Text: If it ain't broke don't fix it
Meaning: Don't alter or change what already works well

Proverb_Text: If the cap fits wear it
Meaning: If criticism applies to you accept it

Proverb_Text: If the mountain won't come to Muhammad Muhammad must go to the mountain
Meaning: If circumstances won't change you must adapt yourself

Proverb_Text: If wishes were horses beggars would ride
Meaning: Wishing alone doesn't make things happen

Proverb_Text: If you can't stand the heat get out of the kitchen
Meaning: If you can't handle pressure or difficulty then leave

Proverb_Text: If you lie down with dogs you'll get up with fleas
Meaning: Bad company causes problems and negative effects

Proverb_Text: If you play with fire you'll get burned
Meaning: Engaging in dangerous activities leads to harm

Proverb_Text: If you want something done ask a busy person
Meaning: Busy productive people are most efficient at completing tasks

Proverb_Text: Ignorance is bliss
Meaning: Not knowing can sometimes be more pleasant than knowing

Proverb_Text: Imitation is the sincerest form of flattery
Meaning: Copying someone shows the highest form of respect

Proverb_Text: In for a penny in for a pound
Meaning: If you start something complete it fully

Proverb_Text: In the kingdom of the blind the one-eyed man is king
Meaning: Even minimal ability stands out where others have none

Proverb_Text: It never rains but it pours
Meaning: Problems or events tend to come in groups all at once

Proverb_Text: It takes all sorts to make a world
Meaning: Different types of people are necessary and that's okay

Proverb_Text: It's a small world
Meaning: The world feels surprisingly interconnected

Proverb_Text: It's always darkest before the dawn
Meaning: Things often improve dramatically after reaching their worst point

Proverb_Text: It's an ill wind that blows nobody any good
Meaning: Almost every situation benefits someone

Proverb_Text: It's better to give than to receive
Meaning: Giving to others is more rewarding than receiving

Proverb_Text: It's better to have loved and lost than never to have loved at all
Meaning: Experiencing love despite pain is better than never loving

Proverb_Text: It's never too late to mend
Meaning: You can always improve or change for the better

Proverb_Text: It's the early bird that catches the worm
Meaning: Those who act early gain advantages

Proverb_Text: Jack of all trades master of none
Meaning: Doing many things prevents mastery of any single skill

Proverb_Text: Keep your friends close and your enemies closer
Meaning: Monitor potential threats more carefully than allies

Proverb_Text: Laugh and the world laughs with you weep and you weep alone
Meaning: People prefer happy company and avoid sad people

Proverb_Text: Learn to walk before you run
Meaning: Master basic skills before attempting advanced ones

Proverb_Text: Least said soonest mended
Meaning: Saying less prevents or repairs damage more quickly

Proverb_Text: Let the cat out of the bag
Meaning: Accidentally reveal a secret

Proverb_Text: Lightning never strikes twice in the same place
Meaning: Unlikely events rarely happen in the same place twice

Proverb_Text: Like father like son
Meaning: Sons often resemble their fathers in behavior and character

Proverb_Text: Little strokes fell great oaks
Meaning: Small repeated efforts can achieve seemingly impossible things

Proverb_Text: Live and let live
Meaning: Allow others to live as they choose without interference

Proverb_Text: Love is blind
Meaning: Love makes people overlook faults and imperfections

Proverb_Text: Man does not live by bread alone
Meaning: Physical sustenance alone is not enough for a full life

Proverb_Text: Man proposes God disposes
Meaning: Human plans are ultimately subject to divine will or fate

Proverb_Text: Many a true word is spoken in jest
Meaning: Jokes and humor often contain underlying truths

Proverb_Text: Many hands make light work
Meaning: Sharing work among many people makes it easier for all

Proverb_Text: Marry in haste repent at leisure
Meaning: Rushing into marriage leads to long-term regret

Proverb_Text: Might is right
Meaning: The powerful determine what is considered right or just

Proverb_Text: Mind your own business
Meaning: Don't interfere in others' private affairs

Proverb_Text: Misery loves company
Meaning: Unhappy people seek out other unhappy people

Proverb_Text: Money talks
Meaning: Wealth provides influence and gets attention

Proverb_Text: More haste less speed
Meaning: Rushing too much actually slows progress

Proverb_Text: Necessity knows no law
Meaning: Desperate situations justify actions normally considered wrong

Proverb_Text: Never say never
Meaning: Don't completely rule out any possibility

Proverb_Text: No man is an island
Meaning: Everyone needs connections and relationships with others

Proverb_Text: No news is good news
Meaning: Absence of bad news suggests everything is fine

Proverb_Text: No rest for the wicked
Meaning: Those who do wrong face constant troubles

Proverb_Text: Nothing ventured nothing gained
Meaning: Taking no risks yields no rewards or achievements

Proverb_Text: Oil and water don't mix
Meaning: Some things or people are fundamentally incompatible

Proverb_Text: Old habits die hard
Meaning: Long-standing behaviors and patterns are very difficult to change

Proverb_Text: Once a thief always a thief
Meaning: People don't fundamentally change their character or nature

Proverb_Text: One good turn deserves another
Meaning: Acts of kindness should be returned with similar kindness

Proverb_Text: One man's meat is another man's poison
Meaning: What benefits one person may harm another

Proverb_Text: One man's trash is another man's treasure
Meaning: What one person discards another may value highly

Proverb_Text: One swallow doesn't make a summer
Meaning: A single instance doesn't prove a general trend

Proverb_Text: Opportunity knocks but once
Meaning: Opportunities are rare and fleeting so seize them

Proverb_Text: Patience is a virtue
Meaning: Being patient is an admirable quality

Proverb_Text: Penny wise pound foolish
Meaning: Being careful with small amounts while wasting large amounts

Proverb_Text: Possession is nine-tenths of the law
Meaning: Actually having something gives strong legal advantage

Proverb_Text: Power corrupts absolute power corrupts absolutely
Meaning: Having power leads to moral decay especially unlimited power

Proverb_Text: Prevention is better than cure
Meaning: Avoiding problems is better than fixing them afterward

Proverb_Text: Procrastination is the thief of time
Meaning: Delaying and postponing wastes valuable time

Proverb_Text: Put your money where your mouth is
Meaning: Back up your words with real action or investment

Proverb_Text: Red sky at night shepherd's delight
Meaning: Red sky in evening predicts good weather tomorrow

Proverb_Text: Revenge is a dish best served cold
Meaning: Delayed calculated revenge is more effective than immediate

Proverb_Text: See no evil hear no evil speak no evil
Meaning: Avoid involvement with or spreading of wrongdoing

Proverb_Text: Seeing is believing
Meaning: Visual proof is the most convincing evidence

Proverb_Text: Seek and ye shall find
Meaning: Those who actively look will discover what they seek

Proverb_Text: Silence is golden
Meaning: Often not speaking is the wisest choice

Proverb_Text: Slow and steady wins the race
Meaning: Consistent steady effort beats hasty rushing

Proverb_Text: Spare the rod and spoil the child
Meaning: Children need discipline to develop properly

Proverb_Text: Speak of the devil and he shall appear
Meaning: People you mention often appear unexpectedly

Proverb_Text: Sticks and stones may break my bones but words will never hurt me
Meaning: Physical harm is worse than verbal insults

Proverb_Text: Take care of the pennies and the pounds will take care of themselves
Meaning: Small savings accumulate into large amounts

Proverb_Text: Talk is cheap
Meaning: Words are easy while actions are valuable and difficult

Proverb_Text: The best defense is a good offense
Meaning: Attacking prevents your opponent from attacking you

Proverb_Text: The best laid plans of mice and men often go awry
Meaning: Even excellent plans can fail unexpectedly

Proverb_Text: The best things in life are free
Meaning: The most valuable things money cannot buy

Proverb_Text: The bigger they are the harder they fall
Meaning: Powerful people fail more dramatically and completely

Proverb_Text: The calm before the storm
Meaning: Unusual quiet often precedes trouble or chaos

Proverb_Text: The course of true love never did run smooth
Meaning: Romantic relationships always face obstacles and challenges

Proverb_Text: The cure is worse than the disease
Meaning: Sometimes remedies cause more harm than the original problem

Proverb_Text: The customer is always right
Meaning: Always prioritize customer satisfaction in business

Proverb_Text: The darkest hour is just before the dawn
Meaning: Things reach their worst point right before improving

Proverb_Text: The end justifies the means
Meaning: Achieving good results justifies questionable methods

Proverb_Text: The exception proves the rule
Meaning: Exceptions actually confirm that general rules exist

Proverb_Text: The eyes are the window to the soul
Meaning: Eyes reveal inner nature and true feelings

Proverb_Text: The first step is always the hardest
Meaning: Starting something new is the most difficult part

Proverb_Text: The hand that rocks the cradle rules the world
Meaning: Mothers who raise children shape society and future

Proverb_Text: The leopard cannot change his spots
Meaning: People cannot fundamentally change their nature

Proverb_Text: The longest journey starts with a single step
Meaning: Great undertakings begin with small initial actions

Proverb_Text: The more you have the more you want
Meaning: Wealth and possessions increase rather than satisfy desire

Proverb_Text: The only constant is change
Meaning: Everything in life changes constantly

Proverb_Text: The pot calling the kettle black
Meaning: Criticizing others for faults you yourself possess

Proverb_Text: The proof is in the pudding
Meaning: Quality and truth are shown through actual results and experience

Proverb_Text: The spirit is willing but the flesh is weak
Meaning: Good intentions exceed physical or mental ability to follow through

Proverb_Text: The straw that broke the camel's back
Meaning: The final small addition that causes complete collapse

Proverb_Text: The way to a man's heart is through his stomach
Meaning: Good cooking wins a man's affection

Proverb_Text: There are none so blind as those who will not see
Meaning: Intentional ignorance is the worst kind of blindness

Proverb_Text: There are two sides to every story
Meaning: Multiple valid viewpoints exist for any situation

Proverb_Text: There but for the grace of God go I
Meaning: I could easily face the same misfortunes as others

Proverb_Text: There is honor among thieves
Meaning: Even criminals have codes of conduct and loyalty

Proverb_Text: There is no smoke without fire
Meaning: Rumors and suspicions usually have some factual basis

Proverb_Text: There is safety in numbers
Meaning: Being in a group provides protection and security

Proverb_Text: There's more than one way to skin a cat
Meaning: Multiple approaches or methods can achieve the same goal

Proverb_Text: There's no such thing as a free lunch
Meaning: Everything has a cost even if not immediately obvious

Proverb_Text: There's no time like the present
Meaning: Now is the best time to act rather than delaying

Proverb_Text: Third time lucky
Meaning: Success often comes after two initial failures

Proverb_Text: Those who cannot remember the past are condemned to repeat it
Meaning: Forgetting history causes repetition of past mistakes

Proverb_Text: Time and tide wait for no man
Meaning: Time passes regardless of anyone's readiness or wishes

Proverb_Text: Time flies when you're having fun
Meaning: Pleasant experiences make time seem to pass quickly

Proverb_Text: Time heals all wounds
Meaning: Emotional pain diminishes and heals with passage of time

Proverb_Text: Time will tell
Meaning: The truth will eventually become clear with time

Proverb_Text: To err is human to forgive divine
Meaning: Making mistakes is natural while forgiving them is godly

Proverb_Text: To the victor go the spoils
Meaning: Winners take all the rewards and benefits

Proverb_Text: Tomorrow is another day
Meaning: Each new day brings new opportunities and fresh starts

Proverb_Text: Too little too late
Meaning: Inadequate action taken after the crucial moment has passed

Proverb_Text: Truth is stranger than fiction
Meaning: Real events can be more unbelievable than imaginary ones

Proverb_Text: Turn the other cheek
Meaning: Don't retaliate when wronged respond with patience

Proverb_Text: Two wrongs don't make a right
Meaning: Retaliating against wrongdoing doesn't justify your own wrongdoing

Proverb_Text: Variety is the spice of life
Meaning: Diversity and change make life interesting and enjoyable

Proverb_Text: Virtue is its own reward
Meaning: Being virtuous is inherently satisfying regardless of external rewards

Proverb_Text: Walls have ears
Meaning: Someone might be secretly listening to your conversations

Proverb_Text: Waste not want not
Meaning: Avoiding waste prevents future shortage and need

Proverb_Text: We'll cross that bridge when we come to it
Meaning: Deal with problems when they actually arise not before

Proverb_Text: What goes up must come down
Meaning: Everything that rises will eventually fall

Proverb_Text: What the eye doesn't see the heart doesn't grieve over
Meaning: Not knowing about problems prevents emotional distress

Proverb_Text: What you don't know won't hurt you
Meaning: Ignorance of problems can sometimes be protective

Proverb_Text: What's done is done
Meaning: Accept past events that cannot be changed

Proverb_Text: What's good for the goose is good for the gander
Meaning: The same rules and standards should apply to everyone

Proverb_Text: When life gives you lemons make lemonade
Meaning: Make the best of bad or difficult situations

Proverb_Text: When one door closes another opens
Meaning: Lost opportunities lead to new different opportunities

Proverb_Text: When poverty comes in the door love flies out the window
Meaning: Financial hardship severely strains romantic relationships

Proverb_Text: When the going gets tough the tough get going
Meaning: Strong people persevere and work harder during difficulties

Proverb_Text: Where there's a will there's a way
Meaning: Strong determination finds methods to overcome obstacles

Proverb_Text: Where there's life there's hope
Meaning: As long as you're alive possibilities and hope exist

Proverb_Text: You can catch more flies with honey than with vinegar
Meaning: Kindness and gentleness are more effective than harshness

Proverb_Text: You can't get blood out of a stone
Meaning: You cannot extract something that doesn't exist

Proverb_Text: You can't have your cake and eat it too
Meaning: You cannot enjoy conflicting benefits simultaneously

Proverb_Text: You can't make a silk purse out of a sow's ear
Meaning: You cannot create quality from inherently poor materials

Proverb_Text: You can't run with the hare and hunt with the hounds
Meaning: You cannot support both opposing sides simultaneously

Proverb_Text: You can't see the forest for the trees
Meaning: Being too focused on details prevents seeing the whole picture

Proverb_Text: You can't unscramble eggs
Meaning: Some actions and changes cannot be undone

Proverb_Text: You must learn to walk before you can run
Meaning: Master fundamental skills before attempting advanced ones

Proverb_Text: You scratch my back and I'll scratch yours
Meaning: Exchange favors and help for mutual benefit

Proverb_Text: Youth is wasted on the young
Meaning: Young people don't appreciate their youth and vitality

Proverb_Text: A watched kettle never boils
Meaning: Watching and waiting makes time feel much longer

Proverb_Text: The show must go on
Meaning: Continue despite difficulties problems or setbacks

Proverb_Text: Every man has his price
Meaning: Everyone can be bribed or bought with enough incentive

Proverb_Text: Fight fire with fire
Meaning: Use the same methods or tactics as your opponent

Proverb_Text: Keep your powder dry
Meaning: Stay prepared and ready for action when needed

Proverb_Text: Life is what you make it
Meaning: You create and shape your own life through choices

Proverb_Text: One man's loss is another man's gain
Meaning: Losses and gains are often redistributed between people

Proverb_Text: Practice what you preach
Meaning: Live according to your own advice and teachings

Proverb_Text: The devil finds work for idle hands
Meaning: Lack of activity and purpose leads to mischief

Proverb_Text: The die is cast
Meaning: The decision has been made and is now irreversible

Proverb_Text: The enemy of my enemy is my friend
Meaning: Common enemies create unlikely friendships and alliances

Proverb_Text: There is no fool like an old fool
Meaning: Older people who act foolishly should know better

Proverb_Text: There's a first time for everything
Meaning: Every experience has an initial occurrence

Proverb_Text: Things aren't always what they seem
Meaning: Appearances often deceive and mislead

Proverb_Text: Think before you speak
Meaning: Consider your words carefully before saying them

Proverb_Text: To know all is to forgive all
Meaning: Complete understanding leads naturally to forgiveness

Proverb_Text: Two's company three's a crowd
Meaning: Two people enjoy intimacy while a third intrudes

Proverb_Text: United we stand divided we fall
Meaning: Unity provides strength while division causes weakness

Proverb_Text: Walk softly and carry a big stick
Meaning: Be diplomatic but maintain power and readiness

Proverb_Text: We are what we eat
Meaning: Our diet directly affects our physical and mental state

Proverb_Text: When it rains it pours
Meaning: Troubles or events tend to come all at once

Proverb_Text: When push comes to shove
Meaning: When a situation becomes truly critical

Proverb_Text: When the chips are down
Meaning: Difficult times reveal true character and priorities

Proverb_Text: Where ignorance is bliss 'tis folly to be wise
Meaning: Sometimes remaining ignorant is preferable to knowing

Proverb_Text: You are never too old to learn
Meaning: Learning ability and opportunity have no age limit

Proverb_Text: You cannot get a quart into a pint pot
Meaning: You cannot exceed natural physical limits and capacity

Proverb_Text: You cannot have it both ways
Meaning: You must choose between mutually exclusive options

Proverb_Text: You cannot make bricks without straw
Meaning: You need proper materials and resources to complete tasks

Proverb_Text: You cannot please everyone
Meaning: Universal approval and satisfaction is impossible to achieve

Proverb_Text: You never know what you can do till you try
Meaning: Attempting reveals your true abilities and potential

Proverb_Text: A new broom sweeps clean
Meaning: New leaders make changes and improvements initially

Proverb_Text: A trouble shared is a trouble halved
Meaning: Sharing problems with others reduces their burden significantly

Proverb_Text: Bad news travels fast
Meaning: Negative information spreads more quickly than positive

Proverb_Text: Behind every successful man is a strong woman
Meaning: Successful people often have supportive capable partners

Proverb_Text: Comparisons are odious
Meaning: Comparing people is unfair and unpleasant

Proverb_Text: Desperate times call for desperate measures
Meaning: Extreme situations require extreme extraordinary actions

Proverb_Text: Don't change horses in midstream
Meaning: Don't make major changes during critical times

Proverb_Text: Don't cut off your nose to spite your face
Meaning: Don't harm yourself in attempts to hurt others

Proverb_Text: Don't get mad get even
Meaning: Retaliate effectively and calmly rather than emotionally

Proverb_Text: Don't kill the goose that lays the golden eggs
Meaning: Don't destroy sources of ongoing benefit for immediate gain

Proverb_Text: Don't meet trouble halfway
Meaning: Don't worry about or seek out future problems

Proverb_Text: Don't teach your grandmother to suck eggs
Meaning: Don't presume to instruct those more experienced

Proverb_Text: Everyone wants to go to heaven but nobody wants to die
Meaning: People want rewards without accepting necessary costs

Proverb_Text: Fine words butter no parsnips
Meaning: Mere words without action accomplish nothing practical

Proverb_Text: From small beginnings come great things
Meaning: Great achievements always start with small actions

Proverb_Text: Give a dog a bad name and hang him
Meaning: Bad reputations are very difficult to overcome

Proverb_Text: Half the truth is often a whole lie
Meaning: Partial truth can be as misleading as complete lies

Proverb_Text: He that is down needs fear no fall
Meaning: Those at the bottom have nothing left to lose

Proverb_Text: He who fights and runs away lives to fight another day
Meaning: Strategic retreat preserves ability to fight later

Proverb_Text: If a job's worth doing it's worth doing well
Meaning: Tasks worth attempting deserve full proper effort

Proverb_Text: If the shoe fits wear it
Meaning: If criticism applies to you accept it gracefully

Proverb_Text: If you want a thing done well do it yourself
Meaning: Personal action ensures proper quality and completion

Proverb_Text: It is better to travel hopefully than to arrive
Meaning: The journey and process matter more than the goal

Proverb_Text: It's an ill bird that fouls its own nest
Meaning: Don't damage or criticize your own home or interests

Proverb_Text: Let well alone
Meaning: Don't disturb or interfere with what already works

Proverb_Text: Life begins at forty
Meaning: Maturity and middle age bring new opportunities and freedom

Proverb_Text: Look after the pennies and the pounds will look after themselves
Meaning: Small careful savings accumulate into large amounts

Proverb_Text: Make haste slowly
Meaning: Work quickly but maintain care and quality

Proverb_Text: Manners maketh man
Meaning: Good manners and behavior define true character

Proverb_Text: Murder will out
Meaning: Serious crimes will eventually be discovered and revealed

Proverb_Text: Nature abhors a vacuum
Meaning: Empty spaces and voids are naturally filled

Proverb_Text: Needs must when the devil drives
Meaning: Desperate circumstances force necessary action

Proverb_Text: Never let the sun go down on your anger
Meaning: Resolve conflicts and anger before day's end

Proverb_Text: No man can serve two masters
Meaning: You cannot maintain divided or conflicting loyalties

Proverb_Text: One hand washes the other
Meaning: Mutual assistance and cooperation benefits both parties

Proverb_Text: One volunteer is worth ten pressed men
Meaning: Willing enthusiastic participants are far more valuable

Proverb_Text: Opportunity makes the thief
Meaning: Easy opportunities and temptations lead people to wrongdoing

Proverb_Text: Out of the mouths of babes and sucklings
Meaning: Children often speak profound unexpected truths

Proverb_Text: Physician heal thyself
Meaning: Fix your own problems before addressing others'

Proverb_Text: Poverty is not a crime
Meaning: Being poor is not morally wrong or criminal

Proverb_Text: Put your best foot forward
Meaning: Make your very best effort and impression

Proverb_Text: Respect is earned not given
Meaning: Respect must be deserved through actions not automatically given

Proverb_Text: Self-praise is no recommendation
Meaning: Praising yourself is not credible or convincing

Proverb_Text: Set a thief to catch a thief
Meaning: Use similar tactics and experience to combat problems

Proverb_Text: Silence gives consent
Meaning: Not objecting to something implies agreement with it

Proverb_Text: Six of one and half a dozen of the other
Meaning: Two options are essentially equivalent in value

Proverb_Text: Something is better than nothing
Meaning: Any amount or help has value compared to none

Proverb_Text: Speech is silver but silence is golden
Meaning: Silence is often more valuable and wise than speaking

Proverb_Text: Take the rough with the smooth
Meaning: Accept both difficult and pleasant aspects of life

Proverb_Text: Tell the truth and shame the devil
Meaning: Be honest and truthful despite potential consequences

Proverb_Text: That's the way the cookie crumbles
Meaning: Accept how things turn out even if disappointing

Proverb_Text: The acorn doesn't fall far from the tree
Meaning: Children closely resemble their parents

Proverb_Text: The cobbler always wears the worst shoes
Meaning: Professionals often neglect their own area of expertise

Proverb_Text: The devil looks after his own
Meaning: Bad or immoral people often seem to prosper

Proverb_Text: The bamboo that bends is stronger than the oak that resists
Meaning: Adaptability and flexibility are forms of strength

Proverb_Text: A closed mouth catches no flies
Meaning: Staying silent avoids trouble and problems

Proverb_Text: The crow thinks its own bird fairest
Meaning: Everyone thinks their own is best regardless of reality

Proverb_Text: Don't count your chickens until they cross the road
Meaning: Don't assume outcomes until fully realized

Proverb_Text: A good beginning makes a good ending
Meaning: How you start determines how you finish

Proverb_Text: He who slings mud loses ground
Meaning: Attacking others damages your own standing

Proverb_Text: The pitcher goes often to the well but is broken at last
Meaning: Repeated risks eventually lead to failure

Proverb_Text: Clothes don't make the monk but they open doors
Meaning: Presentation creates opportunities even if it doesn't define character

Proverb_Text: A rolling stone gathers momentum
Meaning: Continuous action builds force and effectiveness

Proverb_Text: The squeaking gate hangs longest
Meaning: Those who complain or persist often last the longest

Proverb_Text: Better a live dog than a dead lion
Meaning: Being alive in humble circumstances beats noble death

Proverb_Text: The moon is not shamed by the barking of dogs
Meaning: Great things are unaffected by petty criticism

Proverb_Text: One rotten apple spoils the barrel
Meaning: One bad element can corrupt an entire group

Proverb_Text: The fish rots from the head down
Meaning: Organizations fail due to leadership problems first

Proverb_Text: You can't soar with eagles if you scratch with turkeys
Meaning: Your companions limit or enable your potential

Proverb_Text: A bird is known by its song and a man by his talk
Meaning: Speech reveals true character and nature

Proverb_Text: The gem cannot be polished without friction
Meaning: Improvement requires challenge and hardship

Proverb_Text: A single arrow is easily broken but not ten in a bundle
Meaning: Unity provides strength that individuals lack

Proverb_Text: Don't dig your grave with your own knife and fork
Meaning: Don't destroy yourself through poor habits

Proverb_Text: The cheapest is always the most expensive
Meaning: Low quality items cost more in the long run

Proverb_Text: If you chase two rabbits you will lose them both
Meaning: Pursuing multiple goals simultaneously leads to failure

Proverb_Text: The tongue has no bones but it breaks bones
Meaning: Words can cause serious harm despite being intangible

Proverb_Text: A ship in harbor is safe but that's not what ships are for
Meaning: Avoiding all risk means not fulfilling your purpose

Proverb_Text: The tail cannot wag the dog
Meaning: Minor elements cannot control major ones

Proverb_Text: Don't bark if you can't bite
Meaning: Don't threaten unless you can follow through

Proverb_Text: Even a hare will bite when it is cornered
Meaning: Even gentle creatures become dangerous when threatened

Proverb_Text: The loudest drum has nothing in it
Meaning: Those who boast most often have least to offer

Proverb_Text: Better to be alone than in bad company
Meaning: Isolation is preferable to negative associations

Proverb_Text: You cannot cross the sea merely by standing and staring at the water
Meaning: Achievement requires action not just contemplation

Proverb_Text: The mouse that has but one hole is quickly taken
Meaning: Having alternatives and backup plans ensures survival

Proverb_Text: The tree remembers what the axe forgets
Meaning: Victims remember harm that perpetrators dismiss

Proverb_Text: A coward dies a thousand deaths a brave man only once
Meaning: Fear causes more suffering than actual danger

Proverb_Text: The ax forgets but the tree remembers
Meaning: Those harmed remember while those who harm forget

Proverb_Text: The frog in the well knows nothing of the great ocean
Meaning: Limited experience creates limited understanding

Proverb_Text: You can't wake someone who is pretending to be asleep
Meaning: You cannot convince those who refuse to understand

Proverb_Text: The wise man bridges the gap with his tongue
Meaning: Words and diplomacy can resolve conflicts

Proverb_Text: A full cup must be carried steadily
Meaning: Abundance and success require careful management

Proverb_Text: The wolf changes his coat but not his disposition
Meaning: External changes don't alter fundamental nature

Proverb_Text: Don't sell the bear's skin before you've caught the bear
Meaning: Don't profit from or plan around uncertain outcomes

Proverb_Text: He who would climb the ladder must begin at the bottom
Meaning: Advancement requires starting with fundamentals

Proverb_Text: The river that forgets its source will dry up
Meaning: Forgetting your roots leads to failure

Proverb_Text: When spider webs unite they can tie up a lion
Meaning: Collective action achieves what individuals cannot

Proverb_Text: The dog that trots about finds a bone
Meaning: Active effort leads to opportunities and rewards

Proverb_Text: A single bracelet does not jingle
Meaning: Achievement and joy require multiple participants

Proverb_Text: Where water has been the grass will grow again
Meaning: Resources and care enable renewal and growth

Proverb_Text: The goat eats where it is tethered
Meaning: You must work with the situation you're given

Proverb_Text: A wise man changes his mind a fool never will
Meaning: Intelligence includes willingness to reconsider positions

Proverb_Text: Better a diamond with a flaw than a pebble without one
Meaning: Flawed excellence exceeds perfect mediocrity

Proverb_Text: The scaffold is the altar of tyranny
Meaning: Execution and violence are tools of unjust power

Proverb_Text: Life is not a continuum of pleasant choices but of inevitable problems
Meaning: Life consists of managing difficulties not enjoying ease

Proverb_Text: The bee is more honored than other animals not because she labors but because she labors for others
Meaning: Working for others' benefit earns respect

Proverb_Text: One who plants a garden plants happiness
Meaning: Creating beauty and growth brings personal fulfillment

Proverb_Text: A clever person turns great troubles into little ones and little ones into none at all
Meaning: Intelligence minimizes and eliminates difficulties

Proverb_Text: The fire you kindle for your enemy often burns yourself more than them
Meaning: Seeking revenge often harms you more than your target

Proverb_Text: A man who uses force is afraid of reasoning
Meaning: Those who resort to violence lack confidence in their arguments

Proverb_Text: Cross the river in a crowd and the crocodile won't eat you
Meaning: Group action provides protection from danger

Proverb_Text: The wealth which enslaves the owner isn't wealth
Meaning: Possessions that control you have negative value

Proverb_Text: Show me your friend and I will show you your character
Meaning: Your associates reveal your true nature

Proverb_Text: The eye cannot see itself
Meaning: Self-perception is inherently limited and flawed

Proverb_Text: What the fool does in the end the wise man does at the beginning
Meaning: Intelligent people act early while fools delay

Proverb_Text: You never step in the same river twice
Meaning: Everything is constantly changing and evolving

Proverb_Text: A kind word warms for three winters
Meaning: Small kindnesses have lasting powerful effects

Proverb_Text: The tallest trees catch the most wind
Meaning: Achievement and prominence attract criticism and difficulty

Proverb_Text: A journey of a thousand miles must begin where you stand
Meaning: Start from your current position not an ideal one

Proverb_Text: If you bow at all bow low
Meaning: Do things completely or not at all

Proverb_Text: The reputation of a thousand years may be undermined by the conduct of one hour
Meaning: Long-built reputations can be destroyed instantly

Proverb_Text: A society grows great when old men plant trees whose shade they know they shall never sit in
Meaning: True greatness involves sacrificing for future generations

Proverb_Text: When eating bamboo sprouts remember the man who planted them
Meaning: Remember and honor those who provided for you

Proverb_Text: The best time for planning a voyage is when you're on dry land
Meaning: Plan carefully before beginning difficult undertakings

Proverb_Text: Darkness cannot drive out darkness only light can do that
Meaning: Negativity must be countered with positivity not more negativity

Proverb_Text: The person who removes a mountain begins by carrying away small stones
Meaning: Great achievements happen through small consistent efforts

Proverb_Text: Do not protect yourself by a fence but rather by your friends
Meaning: Relationships provide better protection than barriers
